headline: Blueberry Mojitos
description: My easy blueberry syrup takes takes mojitos to a whole new level.
recipeIngredient: 2  medium limes (use the zested ones from the blueberry syrup)
10  fresh mint leaves, plus more for garnish
2 ounces cold seltzer water or club soda

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1: Make the blueberry syrup:
recipeInstructions.text: Finely grate the zest of 2 medium limes (about 2 teaspoons); reserve the zested limes for the cocktail. Place 1 cup fresh or frozen blueberries, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, 1/4 cup water, and 1 pinch kosher salt in a small saucepan.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2: Make the blueberry syrup:
recipeInstructions.text: Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Continue cooking until the berries burst open and release their juices and thicken, 3 to 4 minutes more. Turn off the heat, add the lime zest, and stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3: Make the blueberry syrup:
recipeInstructions.text: Pour through a fine-mesh strainer set over a heatproof bowl. Use a spoon to press on the blueberries to extract as much liquid out of them as possible. Discard the contents of the strainer. You should have about 1/2 cup syrup (if you don’t have enough, add water to make up the difference). Let the syrup cool until warm to the touch, about 10 minutes. Cover and refrigerate until cold, at least 1 hour.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1: For each cocktail:
recipeInstructions.text: Cut 2 to 3 thin rounds from 1 of the zested limes. Press the rounds against the sides of a tall glass. Juice the limes until you have 1 ounce. Fill the glass with ice.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2: For each cocktail:
recipeInstructions.text: Place 10 fresh mint leaves and 1 pinch granulated sugar in a cocktail shaker. Gently muddle the mint leaves with a muddler or wooden spoon until fragrant. Add the lime juice, 2 ounces white rum, and 1 1/4 ounces of the blueberry syrup. Fill the shaker with ice, seal, and shake until the outside of the shaker is very frosty, about 20 seconds.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3: For each cocktail:
recipeInstructions.text: Pour the cocktail through a fine-mesh strainer into the glass. Top with 2 ounces cold seltzer water or club soda, and gently stir to combine. Garnish with 2 to 3 blueberries and mint leaves.

HowtoTip.text: Make ahead: The blueberry syrup can be made up to 5 days ahead and refrigerated in an airtight container.

name: Blueberry Mojitos

author.name: James Park
author.description: James Park is a food content creator, food personality, and social media strategist based in Brooklyn. He was professionally trained at the International Culinary Center. He loves to share his love and passion for Korean cuisine and culture, fried chicken, and all things noodles. He’s currently working on his debut cookbook that’s all about chile crisp.
